Reviewer_1.Reviewer_1.1.1: the authors did not show further supports to their calculations, namely, by comparing the present calculations with experiments or other theoretical method (from other groups)
Reviewer_1.Reviewer_1.1.2: In earlier publications [Physics Reports 315 (1999) 409 and related references], a fully relativistic distorted-wave Born approximation (rDWBA) has been developed to describe the relativistic ionization processes. The authors did not mention this method for discussions in the manuscript. The RPWBA method in the manuscript should be compared with the previous rDWBA theory. At least the authors should mention the differences of the two methods and how far the RPWBA can be compared to rDWBA?
Reviewer_1.Reviewer_1.1.3: Again in earlier publications [Physics Reports 315 (1999) 409 and related references], there are existing experiments of triple differential cross sections for relativistic K-shell ionization of Ag, Au, and so on. The authors did not mention these experimental works in the manuscript. It would be nice if the RPWBA method in the manuscript can be compared with the experiments.
Reviewer_1.Reviewer_1.1.4: The authors have not carefully proofread this manuscript. Evidences of this includes (i) some errors in English typing, e.g. line 27 and line 119: it should be ‘plane wave …’ instead of ‘plan wave …’. Line between 33 and 34: it should be ‘The scattered positron and ejected electron …’ instead of ‘The scattered electron and ejected positron …’. (ii) There are repeated Bibliography like ref. 11 and ref. 31.
Reviewer_1.Reviewer_1.3.1: The manuscript in the present form is suggested to be accepted for publication

Reviewer_2.Reviewer_2.1.1: As for minor problems, there are numerous English grammatical errors which I have attempted to list in order to facilitate publication.
Reviewer_2.Reviewer_2.1.2: In addition, I do believe that several figures could be combined in order to minimize journal space.
